About Me

Let me tell you a few things

BIO

I have a passion for theology, technology and a proactive mentality. I'm a hard working individual, dedicated to the task at hand and pride myself on 'honesty is the best policy'. I enjoy working with people, in a team driven environment, motivating and applying project management techniques to achieve the projects success.

Job Hunting

Project Assistant or Sole Proprietorship Opportunity

October 2020 - Present

Recently retrenched and looking for a permanent job as per my industry related experiences. Willing to learn and travel if need be.

My overall experience has taught me to adapt, to be ready for change and willing to learn. Through the years I've picked up valuble practical experience not taught in any classroom, which I feel is an added benefit to any company or organization.

Reasons for hiring me

- Long term potential

- Ability to work well with others

- Creative problem-solving skills

- Enthusiasim and initiative

Fibre Optic Fusion

Fibre Optic Technician & Junior Project Manager

March 2017 - September 2020

I assisted with running projects from the execution phase to the closing phase of the projects life-cycle. Managing a team of fibre optic technichians and workers. Communicating with stakeholders, head project managers and site foreman alike.

Applying risk and time management techniques to complete the various fibre splicing, testing and fault finding projects. Ensuring that all work is delivered safely, on time and within budget along with managing equipment and material required.

Reason for leaving

Retrenched due to company downsizing caused by Covid-19 pandemic.

Future Technical Services

Assistant Project Manager

May 2016 - February 2017

I managed a project of the rebuilding of a cash office in a Boxer store after it was blown up. Responsible for reinstatement of cash office, safe, security window and safe room door. Quotations, subcontracting, liasioning with Head Office and management.

Key attributes - included recruiting construction teams for the reconstruction, formulating costing and reporting on progress till compeletion.

I also assisted in the maintenence of 5 Puma Filling stations in the Swaziland region.

Electrical, rebranding and general upkeep.

Reason for leaving

Projects ended and I returned to RSA

Alu Projects

Factory Supervisor & Site Foreman

2014-2016

Running daily operations of aluminium manufacturing, frames, doors and glass cutting. Managing and motivating a team of manufacturers/installers in the factory and on site. Controlling quantity, quality, ensuring scope of work is adheared to and customer requirements are met.

Other responsibilities included managing logistics of resources, maintaning the companies' fleet of vehicles and its operational machinery.

Reason for leaving

Company relocated to Cape Town

Mica Centurion

Floor Manager

2008-2014

Gained valuble experience through hard work and dedication. From asking question, listening and applying knowledge learnt for senior management.

Key responsibilities: Supervising staff, assisting with promotions, orders, stock taking, updating management on a daily basis and boosting morale. As well as opening and closing of the business on a regular basis. Drafting of staff rosters for leave days and rotational weekend working days.

Reason for leaving

Minimal growth opportunities

Woodhill Pool, Paint & Hardware

Sales Person

2005 - 2008

I worked as a sales person and assisted with the day to day operations of running a family owned hardware store.

Responsibilities: Sales of hardware store goods, stock inventory, delivery of bricks, sand, cement, gas bottles and other hardware material to clients in the area. Including operating the cash register and daily cash up.

Reason for leaving

Owner sold the business
